Title: Portfolio
Description: This site was created to present my portfolio. I chose to use the MVC pattern because it allows me to separate the concerns of the presentation, logic, and data layers of my website. I also used JSON files as a database because they are easy to create, read, and update, and they can store complex data structures.

Title: TodoList Application
Description: Say goodbye to handwritten to-do lists, with missing details, and say hello to getting all the information you need to get your tasks done.

I created a todo list application that uses ASP.NET Core MVC and Razor pages, as main technologies. I designed the application to be user-friendly and intuitive. I used Entity Framework Core, as the data access layer and connected it to a local database that stores the tasks. It has a console and web version, that uses the same class library.

Title: Iowa Liquor Sales DWH
Description: Liquor sales are an important part of the economy in Iowa. There are many stores and businesses that offer a wide variety of liquors to suit the tastes and preferences of consumers. This industry is highly competitive, and to be successful, it is important to have a deep understanding of the factors that influence consumer choice. One way to gain this understanding is by collecting and analyzing data on liquor sales.

I created a data warehouse that follows a hybrid model of 3NF and Star schemas, using the Inmon and Kimball methodologies. I designed four layers of data flow: the SA layer, where I loaded the csv files from two different source systems; the BL_3NF layer, where I transformed the data into normalized tables; the BL_DM layer, where I converted the data into denormalized tables; and the BL_CL layer, where I performed cleansing and ETL operations. I used surrogate keys to link the tables across different layers and to keep track of the natural keys from the source systems. I also implemented a batch incremental load strategy to update the data warehouse periodically and efficiently.

After creating the data warehouse, I used Power BI to create visualizations that show the insights and trends from the liquor sales data. I connected Power BI to the data warehouse and imported the tables from the BL_DM layer. I created various charts and graphs to display the data. I also used filters and slicers to allow interactive exploration of the data. I arranged the visualizations on a dashboard and added titles and captions to explain the findings.

Title: Analyze Specified Directory
Description: Analyze specified directory with multithreading benchmark.

That application analyzes and shows statistics of specified directory, handles recursive directories. It prints the number of files and the total number of lines, as well as counts non-empty and empty lines. It also counts words and letters, and has performance benchmarks to measure the impact of using the different number of threads.
